sen.j: 奈良（なら）は、日本の歴史的都市で、かつての平城京に当たる。
sen.e: Nara, or 奈良, a historic city in Japan, was once Heijo-kyo Capital.
Nara, or 奈良, a historic city in Japan, was once Heijo-kyo Capital.
Nara, or 奈良, a historic city in Japan, was once Heijo-kyo Capital.

sen.j: 「那羅」「平城」「寧楽」と書いて「なら」と読む事もあった。
sen.e: "Nara" was sometimes written as "那羅," "平城," or "寧楽."
"Nara" was sometimes written as "那羅," "平城," or "寧楽."
Nara' was sometimes written as '那羅,' '平城,' or '寧楽.'

sen.j: 平安京（京都）に都が遷った後は南都（なんと）と呼ばれた。
sen.e: After the capital was moved to Heian-kyo Capital (Kyoto), the city was called Nanto.
After the capital was moved to Heian-kyo Capital (Kyoto), the city was called Nanto.
After the capital was moved to Heian-kyo Capital (Kyoto), the city was called Nanto.

sen.j: 平城京が置かれていた奈良時代には、シルクロードの終着点として国際色豊かな天平文化が花開き、大伽藍が建ち並ぶ都として数々の貴重な文化財が創り出された。
sen.e: In the Nara period when Nara was Heijo-kyo Capital, the city, as the end of the Silk Road, witnessed the flourishing of international Tenpyo culture, and, with magnificent temple buildings standing side by side, the city brought many important cultural assets into the world.

In the Nara period when Nara was Heijo-kyo Capital, the city, as the end of the Silk Road, witnessed the flourishing of international Tenpyo culture, and, with magnificent temple buildings standing side by side, the city brought many important cultural assets into the world.

In the Nara period when Nara was Heijo-kyo Capital, the city, as the end of the Silk Road, witnessed the flourishing of international Tenpyo culture, and, with magnificent temple buildings standing side by side, the city brought many important cultural assets into the world.

sen.j: 国宝建造物数は日本最多。
sen.e: The city is home to the largest number of National Treasure structures in Japan.
The city is home to the largest number of National Treasure structures in Japan.
The city is home to the largest number of National Treasure structures in Japan.

sen.j: 文学の面では古事記、日本書紀、万葉集、風土記など国内最古の史書や歌集が編纂された。
sen.e: In terms of literature, Japan's earliest history books and poem anthologies, such as "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) and fudoki (description of regional climate, culture, etc.), were compiled.

In terms of literature, Japan's earliest history books and poem anthologies, such as "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) and fudoki (description of regional climate, culture, etc.), were compiled.

In terms of literature, Japan's earliest history books and poem anthologies, such as "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) and fudoki (description of regional climate, culture, etc.), were compiled.

sen.j: 平安京への遷都以後も南都と称されて、日本の宗教・文化の歴史において大きな影響を与えた。
sen.e: Even after the relocation of the capital to the Heian-kyo Capital, Nara, known by the name Nanto, had significant impact on Japanese religious and cultural histories.
Even after the relocation of the capital to the Heian-kyo Capital, Nara, known by the name Nanto, had significant impact on Japanese religious and cultural histories.
Even after the relocation of the capital to the Heian-kyo Capital, Nara, known by the name Nanto, had significant impact on Japanese religious and cultural histories.

sen.j: 現在は年間を通して新旧の行事で賑い、国際観光文化都市として国内外から多数の観光客が訪れている。
sen.e: Today, the city is vibrant throughout the year with old and new events, and attracts many tourists from Japan and abroad as an international tourist and cultural city.
Today, the city is vibrant throughout the year with old and new events, and attracts many tourists from Japan and abroad as an international tourist and cultural city.
Today, the city is vibrant throughout the year with old and new events, and attracts many tourists from Japan and abroad as an international tourist and cultural city.

sen.j: 2010年に平城遷都1300年記念事業が開催予定。
sen.e: Commemorative Events of the 1300th Anniversary of Nara Heijo-kyo Capital are scheduled to be held in 2010.
Commemorative Events of the 1300th Anniversary of Nara Heijo-kyo Capital are scheduled to be held in 2010.
Commemorative Events of the 1300th Anniversary of Nara Heijo-kyo Capital are scheduled to be held in 2010.

sen.j: ※明治維新以降の奈良については「奈良市」を参照。
sen.e: For Nara after the Meiji Restoration, refer to the "Nara City."
For Nara after the Meiji Restoration, refer to "Nara City."
For Nara after the Meiji Restoration, refer to 'Nara City.'

sen.j: ※県については「奈良県」を参照。
sen.e: For the prefecture of Nara, refer to the "Nara Prefecture."
For the prefecture of Nara, refer to "Nara Prefecture."
For the prefecture of Nara, refer to 'Nara Prefecture.'

sen.j: 710年（和銅3）藤原京から平城京へ遷都。
sen.e: 710: The capital was moved from Fujiwara-kyo to Heijo-kyo.
710: The capital was moved from Fujiwara-kyo to Heijo-kyo.
710: The capital was moved from Fujiwara-kyo to Heijo-kyo.

sen.j: 724年（神亀元）聖武天皇即位。
sen.e: 724: Emperor Shomu came to the throne.
724: Emperor Shomu came to the throne.
724: Emperor Shomu came to the throne.

sen.j: 729年（天平元）長屋王の変起こる。
sen.e: 729: The Conspiracy of Nagayao took place.
729: The Conspiracy of Nagayao took place.
729: The Conspiracy of Prince Nagaya took place.

sen.j: 752年（天平勝宝4）東大寺大仏の開眼供養が行われる。
sen.e: 752: A ceremony to consecrate the Great Buddha of Todai-ji Temple was held.
752: A ceremony to consecrate the Great Buddha of Todai-ji Temple was held.
752: A ceremony to consecrate the Great Buddha of Todai-ji Temple was held.

sen.j: 東大寺二月堂修二会始まる。
sen.e: Shuni-e (Omizu-tori or Sacred Water-drawing Festival) began at Nigatsu-do Hall of Todai-ji Temple.
Shuni-e (Omizu-tori or Sacred Water-drawing Festival) began at Nigatsu-do Hall of Todai-ji Temple.
Shuni-e (Omizu-tori or Sacred Water-drawing Festival) began at Nigatsu-do Hall of Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 753年（天平勝宝5） 唐より鑑真が来日。
sen.e: 753: Jianzhen came to Japan from Tang Dynasty.
753: Jianzhen came to Japan from Tang Dynasty.
753: Jianzhen came to Japan from Tang Dynasty.

sen.j: 764年（天平宝字8） 藤原仲麻呂（恵美押勝）の乱。
sen.e: 764: Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (EMI no Oshikatsu)
764: Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (EMI no Oshikatsu)
764: Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (EMI no Oshikatsu)
sen.cmt: ここでの「乱」は「rebellion」のままで「war」としていません。

sen.j: 784年（延暦3） 平城京から長岡京へ遷都。
sen.e: 784: The capital was moved from Heijo-kyo to Nagaoka-kyo.
784: The capital was moved from Heijo-kyo to Nagaoka-kyo.
784: The capital was moved from Heijo-kyo to Nagaoka-kyo.

sen.j: 1136年（保延2） 春日若宮おん祭が始まる。
sen.e: 1136: The Kasuga Wakamiya Onmatsuri Festival began.
1136: The Kasuga Wakamiya Onmatsuri Festival began.
1136: The Kasuga Wakamiya Onmatsuri Festival began.

sen.j: 1180年（治承4） 平重衡南都を攻め、東大寺・興福寺を焼く（南都焼討）。
sen.e: 1180: TAIRA no Shigehira provoked the attack on Nanto, and had Todai-ji and Kofuku-ji Temples burnt (Nanto Yakiuchi).
1180: TAIRA no Shigehira provoked the attack on Nanto, and had Todai-ji and Kofuku-ji Temples burnt (Nanto Yakiuchi).
1180: TAIRA no Shigehira provoked the attack on Nanto, and had Todai-ji and Kofuku-ji Temples burnt (Nanto Yakiuchi).

sen.j: 1533年（天文 (元号)2） 奈良町の高天市、次いで南市開かれる。
sen.e: 1533: Takama-ichi and then Minami-ichi Fairs were held in the town of Nara.
1533: Takama-ichi and then Minami-ichi Fairs were held in the town of Nara.
1533: Takama-ichi and then Minami-ichi Fairs were held in the town of Nara.

sen.j: 1559年（永禄2） 松永久秀、多聞山城を築き居城とする。
sen.e: 1559: Hisahide MATSUNAGA had Tamonyama-jo Castle built and lived in the castle.
1559: Hisahide MATSUNAGA had Tamonyama-jo Castle built and lived in the castle.
1559: Hisahide MATSUNAGA had Tamonyama-jo Castle built and lived in the castle.

sen.j: 1567年（永禄10） 東大寺大仏殿の戦いにより東大寺盧舎那仏像の仏頭が焼け落ちる。
sen.e: 1567: The head of the statue of Birushana Buddha in Todai-ji Temple was burnt down during the Battle of Great Buddha Hall of Todai-ji Temple.
1567: The head of the statue of Birushana Buddha in Todai-ji Temple was burnt down during the Battle of Great Buddha Hall of Todai-ji Temple.
1567: The head of the statue of Birushana Buddha in Todai-ji Temple was burnt down during the Battle of Great Buddha Hall of Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 1613年（慶長18） 江戸幕府が奈良奉行を置く。
sen.e: 1613: The Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) created a post of Nara bugyo (magistrate).
1613: The Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) created a post of Nara bugyo (magistrate).
1613: The Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) created a post of Nara bugyo (magistrate).

sen.j: 1664年（寛文4） 奈良を直轄領とし、南都代官所を設置。
sen.e: 1664: The Edo bakufu placed Nara under its direct control, and set up Nanto daikansho (regional office of administrative official).
1664: The Edo bakufu placed Nara under its direct control, and set up Nanto daikansho (regional office of administrative official).
1664: The Edo bakufu placed Nara under its direct control, and set up Nanto daikansho (regional office of administrative official).

sen.j: 1704年（宝永元） 奈良町大火、約2000戸を焼く。
sen.e: 1704: About 2,000 houses were burnt down in the great fire in the town of Nara.
1704: About 2,000 houses were burnt down in the great fire in the town of Nara.
1704: About 2,000 houses were burnt down in the great fire in the town of Nara.

sen.j: 1868年（明治元） 奈良奉行を廃止し、興福寺が町政にあたり、大和鎭撫総督府、奈良府が置かれる。
sen.e: 1868: As the Nara bugyo was abolished, Kofuku-ji Temple took charge of town administration, and Yamato Chinbu Sotoku-fu (Yamato pacification government-general office) and then Nara-fu were established.

1868: As the Nara bugyo was abolished, Kofuku-ji Temple took charge of town administration, and Yamato Chinbu Sotoku-fu (Yamato pacification government-general office) and then Nara-fu were established.

1868: As the Nara bugyo was abolished, Kofuku-ji Temple took charge of town administration, and Yamato Chinbu Sotoku-fu (Yamato pacification government-general office) and then Nara-fu were established.

sen.j: 1875年（明治8） 東大寺大仏殿回廊で第1回奈良博覧会が開催。
sen.e: 1875: The first Nara Exhibition was held in the cloister of the Great Buddha Hall of Todai-ji Temple.
1875: The first Nara Exhibition was held in the cloister of the Great Buddha Hall of Todai-ji Temple.
1875: The first Nara Exhibition was held in the cloister of the Great Buddha Hall of Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 1880年（明治13） 奈良公園開設。
sen.e: 1880: Nara Park opened.
1880: Nara Park opened.
1880: Nara Park opened.

sen.j: 1892年（明治25） 奈良～大阪・湊町間に鉄道開通。
sen.e: 1892: The railway opened between Nara and Minatomachi, Osaka.
1892: The railway opened between Nara and Minatomachi, Osaka.
1892: The railway opened between Nara and Minatomachi, Osaka.

sen.j: 1895年（明治28） 帝国奈良博物館（現奈良国立博物館）が開館。
sen.e: 1895: Imperial Museum of Nara (present-day Nara National Museum) was inaugurated.
1895: Imperial Museum of Nara (present-day Nara National Museum) was inaugurated.
1895: Imperial Museum of Nara (present-day Nara National Museum) was inaugurated.

sen.j: 1898年（明治31） 奈良市制施行。
sen.e: 1898: The municipal system of Nara City was implemented.
1898: The municipal system of Nara City was implemented.
1898: The municipal system of Nara City was implemented.

sen.j: 1910年（明治43） 平城遷都1200年祭開催。
sen.e: 1910: The 1200th Anniversary Festival of Nara Heijo-kyo Capital was held.
1910: The 1200th Anniversary Festival of Nara Heijo-kyo Capital was held.
1910: The 1200th Anniversary Festival of Nara Heijo-kyo Capital was held.

sen.j: 1914年（大正3） 大阪電気軌道（現近鉄奈良線）大阪上本町～奈良間開通。
sen.e: 1914: Osaka Electric Tramway (present-day Kintetsu Nara Line) began operating between Uehonmachi Station in Osaka and Nara Station.
1914: Osaka Electric Tramway (present-day Kintetsu Nara Line) began operating between Uehonmachi Station in Osaka and Nara Station.
1914: Osaka Electric Tramway (present-day Kintetsu Nara Line) began operating between Uehonmachi Station in Osaka and Nara Station.

sen.j: 1921年（大正10） 平城宮跡が史跡に指定。
sen.e: 1921: Heijo Palace Site was designated as a historic site.
1921: Heijo Palace Site was designated as a historic site.
1921: Heijo Palace Site was designated as a historic site.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63） 奈良市制90周年。
sen.e: 1988: 90th anniversary of the municipal system of Nara City.
1988: 90th anniversary of the municipal system of Nara City.
1988: 90th anniversary of the municipal system of Nara City.

sen.j: なら・シルクロード博開催。
sen.e: Nara Silk Road Exposition was held.
Nara Silk Road Exposition was held.

sen.j: 平城宮跡で長屋王邸宅跡出土。
sen.e: Remains of Prince Nagaya's mansion were excavated at the Heijo Palace Site.

sen.j: 1998年（平成10） 奈良市制100周年。

sen.j: 古都奈良の文化財が世界遺産に登録される。

sen.j: 「奈良」の語源としては「平らな、平坦な（土地）」を意味する「なら（す）」であるという説が有力である。
sen.e: According to the widely accepted theory, the word "Nara" is derived from "nara (su)" meaning "flat or even (land)."
According to the widely accepted theory, the word "Nara" is derived from "nara (su)" meaning "flat or even (land)."
According to the widely accepted theory, the word 'Nara' is derived from 'nara (su)' meaning 'flat or even (land).'

sen.j: 直接には、｢則ち精兵を率ゐて、進みて那羅山に登りて軍いくさす。時に官軍屯聚して、草木を蹢跙す。因りて其の山を號して、那羅山と曰ふ。蹢跙、此を布瀰那羅須ふみならすと云ふ｣〈『日本書紀』崇神天皇 10 年〉に拠る。
sen.e: The word, however, comes directly from "quickly led elite soldiers up to Mt. Nara where the soldiers fought a war. Then, the Imperial army soldiers got together to stamp (narasu, 蹢跙す) the plants. Therefore, the mountain was given the name Mt. Nara. Here, "蹢跙" means to stamp." (88 B.C., "Nihonshoki")

The word, however, comes directly from "quickly led elite soldiers up to Mt. Nara where the soldiers fought a war. Then, the Imperial army soldiers got together to stamp (narasu, 蹢跙す) the plants. Therefore, the mountain was given the name Mt. Nara. Here, "蹢跙" means to stamp." (88 B.C., "Nihonshoki")

The word, however, comes directly from 'quickly led elite soldiers up to Mt. Nara where the soldiers fought a war. Then, the Imperial army soldiers got together to stamp (narasu, 蹢跙す) the plants. Therefore, the mountain was given the name Mt. Nara. Here, '蹢跙' means to stamp.' (88 B.C., "Nihonshoki")

sen.j: 朝鮮語で「国」という意味の「나라（発音ナラ）」を語源とする説もある。
sen.e: Some theories suggest that "Nara" comes from the Korean word "나라 (pronounced as nara)" meaning "country."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「나라」が抜けていましたので、原文・訳文ともにウェブからコピーして貼り付けました。
sen.e: Some theories suggest that "Nara" comes from the Korean word "나라 (pronounced as nara)" meaning "country."
Some theories suggest that 'Nara' comes from the Korean word '나라 (pronounced as nara)' meaning 'country.'

sen.j: しかし、歴史的根拠に乏しく、「ナラ」の呼称が出る万葉集時代に朝鮮で「나라（発音ナラ）」と言う言葉が用いられていたことを示す文献等は現在存在しない。
sen.e: These theories, however, lack historical grounds, and literature, etc. showing that "나라 (pronounced as nara)" was used in Korea during time of Manyoshu when the name "Nara" appeared are yet to be found.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「나라」が抜けていましたので、原文・訳文ともにウェブからコピーして貼り付けました。
sen.e: These theories, however, lack historical grounds, and literature, etc. showing that "나라 (pronounced as nara)" was used in Korea during the time of the Manyoshu when the name "Nara" appeared are yet to be found.

These theories, however, lack historical grounds, and literature, etc. showing that '나라 (pronounced as nara)' was used in Korea during the time of the Manyoshu when the name 'Nara' appeared are yet to be found.
